headline: Virtus Investment Partners’ Just Paid Investors $2.40 In Dividends
summary: Virtus Investment Partners just paid shareholders $2.40 per share on February 11, 2026, continuing a decade-long streak of quarterly distributions. But beneath the surface of this 6.56% yield, a troubling cash flow picture raises questions about how long the asset manager can sustain its aggressive payout and buyback strategy. Dividend Growth Meets Cash Flow Reality ... Virtus Investment Partners’ Just Paid Investors $2.40 In Dividends

headline: Hong Kong's CK Hutchison warns of legal action over Panama Canal ports
summary: Hong Kong’s CK Hutchison Holdings warned of legal action on Thursday against a Danish logistics and ports group, after the latter was tapped by Panamanian authorities to temporarily take over the operation of two critical ports at both ends of the Panama Canal from the Hong Kong conglomerate.  Panama’s Supreme Court ruled in late January that the concession held by a subsidiary of CK Hutchison to operate the two ports on the Panama Canal was unconstitutional.

raw.headline: Hong Kong's CK Hutchison warns of legal action over Panama Canal ports
raw.summary: Hong Kong’s CK Hutchison Holdings warned of legal action on Thursday against a Danish logistics and ports group, after the latter was tapped by Panamanian authorities to temporarily take over the operation of two critical ports at both ends of the Panama Canal from the Hong Kong conglomerate.  Panama’s Supreme Court ruled in late January that the concession held by a subsidiary of CK Hutchison to operate the two ports on the Panama Canal was unconstitutional.

headline: BlackRock: 1% of Asian wealth could trigger $2T crypto boom
summary: BlackRock's Nicholas Peach says a 1% allocation of Asian household wealth to crypto could bring to the market nearly $2 trillion in inflows. Speaking at Consensus Hong Kong, Peach highlighted that this shift would equal roughly 60% of the entire current crypto market cap. CoinDesk's Jennifer Sanasie hosts "CoinDesk Daily."

headline: Why "Golden Handcuffs" are a Gift to Homebuilders in 2026
summary: As high mortgage rates keep existing homes off the market, a perfect storm of restricted supply and federal incentives is positioning homebuilders for an unlikely breakout year in 2026.

headline: BlackRock Uniswap Move Puts Tokenized Treasuries And Valuation In Focus
summary: BlackRock has brought its U.S. Treasury backed digital token BUIDL onto Uniswap, a leading decentralized finance trading platform. The firm has also invested in Uniswap's governance token as part of the move. This is the first integration of a tokenized money market fund with DeFi trading infrastructure. For investors watching NYSE:BLK, this step highlights how a major asset manager is engaging directly with tokenized Treasuries and DeFi rails. BlackRock shares currently trade at $1,082.88,...
